Turn Questions into Keywords

Posted by The WI+RE Team on January 02, 2010

Develop your research questions into keywords before you search. Think about your topic from a variety of perspectives to generate a big list of keywords.

Give it a try:

First, identify the core concepts in one of your research questions. Then, generate multiple synonyms and alternative phrasings for each core concept.

Tips:

  • ondemand_videoWatch this quick video on crafting a savvy search strategy for more ideas on generating keywords for search:
  • chatGet expert advice:

    Ask your instructor or a researcher in the field for their advice on the best keywords to use for your search.

    Ask a librarian 24/7 chat service.

    Set up a research consultation at a UCLA Library.
